name: Diddly Squat Farm Shop
description: Diddly Squat Farm Shop, operated by the Clarkson family, is a renowned family-run farm in Oxfordshire. Committed to sustainable agriculture, it offers a delightful range of organic vegetables, fresh eggs, local honey, and premium meats, all sourced from their own fields and livestock.

name: Murton Farm Shop
description: Located in the heart of the Gower Peninsula, Murton Farm Shop is a family-run business with over 150 years of market gardening heritage. It offers freshly grown vegetables, fruits, free-range eggs, and local Welsh produce, emphasizing quality and sustainability.

name: Gower Salt Marsh Lamb
description: Situated on the scenic Gower Peninsula, this traditional Welsh farm specializes in award-winning salt marsh and mountain lamb, renowned for its unique flavor from coastal grasslands rich in samphire and sea lavender. The farm also produces exquisite local honey.

name: Forage Farm Shop
description: Located on Penllyn Estate, Forage Farm Shop has been farmed by the Homfray family since 1846. Today, the farm grows feed wheat, oil seed rape, maize and vegetables, alongside a livestock operation focusing on rearing cattle, sheep and pigs, as well as free-range chickens. The farm shop sells fully traceable, seasonal and local produce wherever possible – including from the estate.

name: Rhug Estate
description: After taking over Rhug Estate farm in 1998 following the death of his father, Lord Newborough has grown the Rhug into one of the largest organic farms in the UK, and a true icon of field-to-fork food. Set within 12,500 acres, the estate continues to innovate, including pushing for higher standards of sustainability with the adoption of green energy, compostable and recyclable packaging and low food miles in recent years.

name: Hawarden Estate Farm Shop
description: Based on the edge of North Wales near Chester, Hawarden Estate has historic roots, with iron age origins, and an 18th century castle once home to four-time prime minister William Gladstone. The first farm shop on the site opened 18 years ago, and has since grown into a thriving business with attached café and bakery, where they make all their loaves and cakes in house each and every day.

name: Beacons Farm Shop
description: Located at the Welsh Venison Centre, Beacons Farm Shop was established in 1985 by the Morgan family. Based in the Brecon Beacons National Park, the shop is now run by husband and wife Andrew and Elaine Morgan, who sell high-quality, fresh meat from their own farm.

name: Gate 2 Plate Farm Shop
description: Since opening in 2007 just two miles from the family run farm, Gate 2 Plate has become a go-to destination for quality, home-reared beef, rare breed pork, Pembrokeshire potatoes and seasonal vegetables. On the farm, the family traditionally rear beef cattle, which is expertly hung for weeks to provide a fantastic flavour and tenderness.

name: Lewis's Farm Shop
description: Award-winning Lewis's Farm Shop in Eyton near Wrexham, was established in 2006 by Mark and Jayne Lewis, and prides itself on offering top-quality produce with a 'hearty welcome'. In its early days, the shop only sold fresh lamb from the farm, but as demand for local produce skyrocketed, the business expanded.

name: Square Farm Shop
description: Focusing on traditional farming methods, Square Farm Shop is a family-run business known for its home-grown organic produce as well as a range of local products from the Wye Valley and surrounding areas. The farm dates back to 1978 when it was founded by Mr and Mrs Whittall, and it is now owned and operated by their son, Robert.

name: Slade Farm Organics
location: St Brides Major, Vale of Glamorgan
description: Slade Farm Organics is run by Polly and Graeme, third generation farmers in St Brides Major, who prioritise working with nature and the local community. The farm delivers organic, sustainable produce through a closed cycle of nutrients, meaning all the farm's animals and crops are fed from their own 650 acres of mixed livestock and arable farming land in South Wales.

name: Rothiemurchus Estate Farm Shop
description: Rothiemurchus Estate Farm Shop, nestled in the heart of the Cairngorms National Park, offers a wide range of locally produced and sourced products. Passionate about sustainability and ethical farming, the shop features home-reared Highland beef, forest venison, and rainbow trout, alongside a superb selection of cheeses, local beers, whiskies, and artisan preserves. Visitors can also enjoy the stunning scenery of Loch An Eilein, voted Britain's Best Picnic Spot.

name: Daylesford Organic
description: Daylesford Organic, located in the heart of the Cotswolds, is a celebrated farm shop offering a wide range of organic produce. It features fruit and vegetables from its market garden, pasture-raised meat, artisan bread, and award-winning cheese, emphasizing sustainability and quality.

name: Chatsworth Estate Farm Shop
description: The Chatsworth Estate Farm Shop, established by Duchess Deborah in 1977, celebrates local suppliers and estate-grown produce. Located in the picturesque village of Pilsley, it offers high-quality meat, dairy, vegetables, and artisan cheeses, all sourced from the estate and trusted local producers.

name: Cowdray Farm Shop
description: Cowdray Farm Shop, situated on the Cowdray Estate, offers premium country produce, including award-winning venison, beef, and lamb, alongside artisan cheeses and deli products. Its commitment to local sourcing and quality makes it a standout destination in West Sussex.

name: Doddington Hall Farm Shop
description: Doddington Hall Farm Shop, opened in 2007, is an award-winning destination for seasonal, local food. It features fruit and vegetables from its restored kitchen garden, beef from its Lincoln Red cattle herd, and a variety of artisan products, showcasing Lincolnshire's agricultural heritage.

name: Battlefield 1403
description: Battlefield 1403, located next to the historic Battle of Shrewsbury site, is a farm shop, butchery, café, and visitor centre. It offers locally sourced beef, lamb, honey, and home-cooked ready meals, blending Shropshire's rich produce with historical significance.

name: Alder Carr Farm Shop
location: Creeting St. Mary, Ipswich, Suffolk IP6 8LX
description: Alder Carr Farm Shop, a family-run enterprise in Suffolk, produces high-quality home-grown produce. Known for its free-range beef, lamb, eggs, and award-winning fruit ice cream, it offers a delightful range of local and artisan foods.

name: Kimbers Farm Shop
description: Kimbers Farm Shop, a family-run business farming for over 300 years in Somerset's Blackmore Vale, specializes in ethically reared meat, including beef, veal, turkey, poultry, lamb, and pork. It also offers local produce, emphasizing quality and animal welfare.

name: Gloagburn Farm Shop
description: Gloagburn Farm Shop, family-run since 2003 in Perthshire, specializes in traditional beef and pork products, including sausages, burgers, and steaks. Its homemade savouries and hampers are popular, complemented by a selection of local produce and artisan foods.

name: Connage Highland Dairy
description: Home of the Cheese Pantry and Deli at Connage where they make a range of fine cheeses on their family farm. Now also with a fabulous vending machine service…the Connage Express. You can visit their beautiful shop and check out their range of traditional and innovative cheeses.

name: The Ethical Dairy
description: The Finlay family reintroduced cheese making to Rainton Farm in 2013 after a 40 year break giving an opportunity to experiment and explore the flavours and textures of different types of cheese. They now have a fabulous range of cheeses, all made with ethical farming practices.

name: Craigie's Farm Deli & Cafe
description: The Sinclair family have created a wonderful destination here on the outskirts of Edinburgh. Originally – and still is – a berry farm, their fabulous produce takes you through the seasons from their PYO berries, apple orchards to pumpkins later in the year.

name: Hardiesmill
description: RBST Winner 2023 Sustainable Farm of the Year, Hardiesmill is home to Alison, Robin and their family where they rear pasture fed pedigree Native Aberdeen Angus. Online sales, a regular at Kelso Farmers' Market plus their lovely Farm Shop open to visitors.

name: Peel Farm
description: Welcome to Peel Farm, a working family farm with imaginative diversifications that will keep you entertained all day – and even to stay longer. The Flemings are onto the third generation of this Angus farming family, offering a complete farm experience.

name: Galloway Farmhouse Cheese
description: A fabulous award-winning range of organic artisan cheeses created in the heart of rural Wigtonshire. The Cairnsmore is their speciality cheese and they specialise in ewe's milk cheese however the range also includes cow and goat's milk versions.

name: Carmichael Venison & Farmhouse Kitchen
description: Heading southwards on the A73 – so pleasant to avoid motorways – you will find Carmichael Estate Farm Shop and can pause for tasty home baking at their Clan Farmhouse Kitchen. The Carmichael family have been farming these lands for 700 years and today offer a complete farm experience.

name: Loch Arthur Creamery, Farm Shop and Cafe
description: The Loch Arthur Creamery and Farmshop is a great asset to Dumfries and Galloway. Creating a home, community, family and valued work, The Camphill Community offers 'co-operation not competition' to co-workers and has resulted in an organic food hub creating award-winning dairy produce.

name: Isle of Mull Cheese
description: This family of farmhouse artisan cheesemakers use their own dairy herds and traditional methods to produce stunning award-winning unpasteurised Traditional Isle of Mull, and Hebridean Blue cheeses, along with Cloth Bound Tobermory Truckles and naturally flavoured wax coated Isle of Mull cheeses.

name: Ardross Farm
description: 2021 Winner of The Best Farm Shop & Deli in Scotland in the Great British Food Awards. A huge congratulations goes to their awesome team for all the hours spent caring for their animals on the farm, cooking the most delicious food and providing excellent customer service.

name: Balgove Larder
location: Strathtyrum Farm, Strathtyrum, St Andrews, Fife KY16 9SF
description: Started in 2010 by Will Docker and Henry Cheape to showcase Scottish produce, focusing on traditional farm retail and hospitality with single-link supply chains. Includes a shop, butchery, cafe, and Steak Barn restaurant in a former sawmill, emphasizing sustainability and community.

name: Grow Wild
description: A farm shop offering fresh, organic produce, evolved from a delivery business established in 1998. Focuses on sustainability, organic, and natural lifestyles, with a warm atmosphere and knowledgeable team.

name: The Heron Farm Shop
description: Established in 2018 by Emma and Angus on their 122-acre farm, initially with Scottish Blackface breeding ewes and a Christmas tree plantation. Offers home-reared and local meats, focusing on quality products with good provenance.

name: Bowhouse
location: St Monans, East Neuk, Anstruther, Fife KY10 2DB
description: Based on Balcaskie Estate, covering 2,000 acres of organic and regeneratively farmed land in the East Neuk of Fife, developed as a centre for food and drink, known for monthly market weekends.

name: Loch Leven's Larder
description: Opened in 2005 by Emma and Robin Niven on their family farm by Loch Leven, started with a café and market stall, now employs over 80 staff, with over 200,000 annual visitors.

name: Blair Drummond Smiddy Farm Shop
description: Farm shop stocking local produce from local suppliers and farms, with an excellent café.

name: Barra Berries
description: Aberdeen soft fruit producers known for producing fine fresh berries in the North-east.

name: Balgone Estate
description: A farm perched on the coast of East Lothian with views of the North Sea and Berwick Law, offering pumpkin picking in a 10-acre patch with 27 varieties, a Haunted Trail, and the Crooked Cauldron for toasted marshmallows.

name: Westerton Farmers
description: An arable farm passionate about reconnecting people with nature, offering a 'pick your own' scheme including pumpkin picking in October. Features a Farm to Table shop and refillery with local produce.

name: Glenforsa
description: A café and farm shop on the east coast of Mull, inspired by fresh island ingredients, offering dishes like Isle of Mull Rarebit and West Coast Fish Plate with local mackerel pâté and smoked salmon.

name: Wilson's Farm & Kitchen
description: A family-run farm for three generations, offering Field to Fork tours and themed food experiences like curry nights and 25-mile BBQ or roast lunch with seasonal, locally sourced ingredients within a 25-mile radius.

name: Long Island Retreats and Larder
description: Run by 6th-generation crofters, offering authentic farm experiences with wildlife, livestock, and Gaelic language, including Field to Fork experiences and picnic baskets for island tours.

name: Solsgirth Home Farm
description: A 100-year-old farm with 260 acres of woodland and pasture, focusing on conservation and healthy food, offering farm tours, hands-on experiences, monthly farmers markets, and workshops like stick carving and beekeeping.

name: Broughgammon Farm
location: 50 Straid Road, Ballycastle, County Antrim BT54 6NP
description: A family farm dedicated to producing ethical, sustainable meat and artisan produce through nature-friendly farming.

name: Hillstown Farm Shop
location: 128 Glebe Road, Ahoghill, County Antrim BT42 2HZ
description: Multi-award-winning farm shop offering meats direct from farm to fork, with online delivery options.

name: Millbank Farm Shop
description: A sixth-generation family farm growing over 40 varieties of vegetables, with a focus on fresh produce.

name: McKee's Country Store, Farm Shop & Restaurant
location: 28 Hollywood Road, Newtownards, County Down BT23 7ED
description: On a working 162-hectare farm, the food emporium incorporates a bakery, butcher, deli, plus fruit, vegetable, and dairy sections.

name: Ballykenver Farm Shop and Kitchen
location: 77 Ballykenver Road, Armoy, County Antrim BT53 8RP
description: A farm shop and kitchen offering local produce in a scenic location.

name: Apley Farm Shop
description: Focuses on traditional farming, quality food, and family time, an award-winning experience with various attractions.

name: Arrow Farm Shop
description: Owned and run by the Blagg Family with over half a century of farming experience, opened in 1991.

name: Ashlyns Farm Shop
description: Dedicated to stocking the best fresh, local, and organic produce.

name: Downland Produce
description: A destination for top-quality, locally sourced meats with a commitment to excellence.

name: Dews Meadow Farm Shop
description: An independent, family-run butchery and farm shop offering high-welfare products.

name: Barnhill Farmshop
description: A working farm and farm shop set amongst 70 acres of land on the outskirts.

name: Barr Farm
description: Cattle and pigs produce delicious and nutritious meat sold direct from the farm gate.

name: Aunt Fanny's Farm Shop & Cafe
description: Farm shop stocked with a variety of delicious local produce not found in regular shops.

name: Craigies Deli & Farm Shop
location: West Craigie Farm, Queensferry, Edinburgh EH30 9AR
description: Run by fourth-generation farmer John Sinclair and his family, including wife Kirsteen, children Sophie and George, and John's mother Anne. Transformed from a struggling beef and dairy farm into a thriving soft fruit and vegetable business with a shop, cafe, and activities like pick your own and Little Farmers adventure farm park, attracting 260,000 visitors a year.

name: Balmakewan Farm Shop & Tea Room
description: A farm shop and tea room serving tea, coffee, and cake on a welcoming farm.

name: Darts Farm
description: Over 50 years ago, Ronald Dart pioneered UK pick-your-own farming. After his passing, sons Paul, Michael, and James transformed Darts Farm into a celebrated Exeter hub for farm-to-table dining, local produce, artisan goods, and sustainable practices, championing regional flavours through vibrant restaurants, a café, cheesemonger, and butchery. Winner of Large Farm Shop of the Year at Farm Retail Awards 2025.

name: Castle Farm
description: Castle Farm is a 4th generation family-run, 1,200-acre farm in Kent, centred around its Farm Shop. Offering a diverse range of home-grown produce, including hops and lavender, visitors can enjoy seasonal activities like PYO sunflowers and pumpkin picking. In the summer months, our Lavender fields burst into colour across the Kent landscape, and we harvest and extract pure Lavender Oil. The farm’s own beef, apples, apple juice, Kentish hop garlands, dried flowers, pumpkins, Lavender oils, food essences, Lavender teas, and honey are all sold through our unique, award-winning farm shop, and online, along with carefully selected gifts, cards, crafts, seasonal decorations, food hampers, and local, traceable produce. Winner of Small Farm Shop of the Year at Farm Retail Awards 2025.

name: Garson Farm
description: Garson Farm PYO, one of the UK's largest, spans over 155 acres in Esher, Surrey. Family-run since 1871, the farm's fresh produce was transported to the London market traders up to 1981 when it opened to the public. From May to October, the farm attracts over 115,000 visitors, offering around 30 crops of fruits, vegetables, and flower crops. Winner of Pick Your Own of the Year at Farm Retail Awards 2025.

name: Millets Farm Centre
description: Millets Farm Centre, originally a dairy farm purchased in 1952 by John and Christine Carter, has evolved over the years into a site that includes a farm shop, Webbs Garden Centre, independent retailers, restaurants, and various attractions like Sprouts Playbarn and Adventure Golf. The family has invested in new infrastructure and landscaping while maintaining a commitment to growing and producing high-quality food and providing a space for family entertainment and community engagement. Two generations of the family continue to run the farm, upholding their farming heritage. Winner of Farm Shop Butchery of the Year at Farm Retail Awards 2025.
specialties: High-quality food grown and produced on the farm

name: River Cottage Kitchen and Store
description: Situated atop of their working farm, above the Cookery School and Farmhouse, the River Cottage Kitchen & Store is ideal for breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea, or evening drinks. Enjoy stunning views of the Axe Valley and Jurassic coast in their casual, dog-friendly space that embraces the essence of River Cottage HQ. At River Cottage, every bite tells a story. The food is rooted in their farm, where they grow much of their own produce, and everything else comes from trusted local partners. It is seasonal, local, organic, and whole, reflecting a deep connection to nature, flavour, and quality, as part of Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall’s vision for a more thoughtful way to eat and live. Winner of Rising Star of the Year at Farm Retail Awards 2025.
specialties: Seasonal produce grown on the farm

name: Strawberry Fields
description: Strawberry Fields is a family-run farm shop in Devon, focusing on offering quality homemade and own produce from their 200-acre farm. Led by Jo Mounce, it has become one of the UK’s largest farm shops. Winner of Lifetime Achievement Award at Farm Retail Awards 2025 for outstanding contribution to the sector.

name: Farmer Copleys
location: Ravensknowle Farm, Pontefract Road, Pontefract WF7 5AF
description: Farmer Copleys is a family-run farm shop in Pontefract, offering a range of local produce and experiences. Winner of Farm Shop Large and North of England regional winner at Farm Shop & Deli Retailer Awards 2025.

name: Brunswick Organic Nursery Shop
description: Brunswick Organic Nursery Shop is a small farm shop in York, focusing on organic produce. Winner of Best Retailer – Farm Shop (Small) at Farm Shop & Deli Retailer Awards 2025.

name: Fordhall Farm Shop
description: Fordhall Organic Farm is England's first community-owned farm, located in Market Drayton, north Shropshire. It has been chemical-free for over 70 years and is managed by tenant farmer Ben Hollins, who rears pasture-fed cattle, sheep, and free-range pigs using a Foggage farming system. The farm is community-owned through the Fordhall Community Land Initiative, a charitable community benefit society, following a campaign in 2006 supported by over 8,000 people worldwide. It aims to demonstrate that low-input organic farming, connected to the local community, offers a viable way of life for future generations. The farm is family-run, dog-friendly, and welcomes cyclists, offering free entry and operating with specific opening hours for the farm and café. It also serves as a space for community relaxation, well-being, and fun. Winner of Best Retailer – Online Business at Farm Shop & Deli Retailer Awards 2025.

name: Marshall’s Farm Shop
description: Marshall’s Farm Shop is a family-run business owned and operated by Farmer Kenny Marshall, his wife Moira, and their three daughters, Christine, Julie, and Shona, alongside 20 full-time employed staff members. The shop has recently opened a brand new, larger area to stock more local products, including their own homegrown vegetables, free range eggs, and fresh meat. It also features a new bakery with home-baked bread, cakes, desserts, and ice creams. Adjacent to the shop, there are two securely fenced dog fields for dogs to roam freely, equipped with shelters, picnic tables, and drinking water facilities, available for booking online. The shop also includes a kitchen and a Fireside Bothy, with various seating options for dining, and a drive-through for snacks and beverages. Winner of Regional Winner – Scotland at Farm Shop & Deli Retailer Awards 2025.
